lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Reverie.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Reverie.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Represents the main Reverie chatbot application.
* A Reverie object manages the task list, user interface, storage,
* Constructs a Reverie chatbot with the specified file path for data storage.
* Initializes the UI, storage, and attempts to load existing tasks from file.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
* Runs the main command loop of the chatbot.
* Continuously reads user commands, parses them, executes them,
* and displays results until an exit command is received.
* Main entry point of the Reverie application.
* Creates a new Reverie instance with default data file path and starts the program.
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* An AddCommand adds a new task and saves it to storage.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to add to the task list.
* Executes the add command to add the task to the list and save it to storage.
* @param tasks The task list to add to.
* @param ui The UI to display confirmation.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws ReverieException If there is an error saving to storage.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ReverieException {
* Represents an abstract command in the Reverie chatbot.
* A Command object encapsulates a user action that can be executed.
* Executes the command with the provided task list, UI, and storage.
* @param tasks The task list to operate on.
* @param ui The UI for user interaction.
* @param storage The storage for persisting tasks.
* @throws ReverieException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ReverieException;
* Indicates whether this command will cause the application to exit.
* @return True if this is an exit command, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* A DeleteCommand removes a task at the specified index
* and saves the updated task list to storage.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified arguments.
* @param arguments The task number to delete.
* Executes the delete command to remove a task from the list.
* The task list is saved to storage after deletion.
* @param tasks The task list to delete from.
* @param ui The UI to display deletion confirmation.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws ReverieException If the task list is empty, task number is invalid, or storage fails.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ReverieException {
throw new ReverieException("No tasks available to delete! Add some tasks first.");
throw new ReverieException("Please specify a task number to delete");
throw new ReverieException("Please enter a valid number after 'delete'");

* @param tasks The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui The UI to display the goodbye message.
* @param storage The storage (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this is an exit command.
* Represents a command to find tasks matching a keyword.

* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.

* The search is case-insensitive and matches against the full task representation.

* @param storage The storage (not used in this command).

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ReverieException {
throw new ReverieException("Please specify a keyword to search for");
* Represents a command to list all tasks.
* A ListCommand displays all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command to display all tasks.
* @param tasks The task list to display.
* @param ui The UI to display the task list.
* @param storage The storage (not used in this command).
* @throws ReverieException If there is an error accessing the tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ReverieException {
* Represents a command to mark or unmark a task as done.
* A MarkCommand changes the completion status of a task
* and saves the updated task list.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified arguments and mark flag.
* @param arguments The task number to mark/unmark.
* @param isMark True to mark as done, false to unmark.

* @param ui The UI to display confirmation.
* @param storage The storage to save the updated task list.
* @throws ReverieException If the task list is empty, task number is invalid, or storage fails.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws ReverieException {
throw new ReverieException("No tasks available to mark!");
throw new ReverieException("Please specify a task number to " + (isMark ? "mark" : "unmark"));
throw new ReverieException("Please enter a valid number after '" + (isMark ? "mark" : "unmark") + "'");

throw new ReverieException("Invalid date format! Please use yyyy-MM-dd (e.g., 2019-12-02)");
